[[File:Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex.jpg|alt=Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex|centric|vignette|628x628px|Normal and pathological direct and consensual photomotor reflex. In this example, the right eye is illuminated]]

properties.question: What does a normal direct photomotor reflex indicate during an eye examination?
properties.option_a: The pupil of the right eye constricts when light is shone into it, and there is no response in the left eye.
properties.option_b: Both pupils constrict equally when light is shone into either eye.
properties.option_c: The pupil of the left eye constricts when light is shone into the right eye, but not the other way around.
properties.option_d: Neither pupil reacts to light being shone into either eye.
